comment.text:
Works for me.. The enabled Default and Performance tests pass OK.

Work Station > Ryzen5 5600g/AMDGPU 400 Series Chipset. (UEFI + Secure Boot). SSD's > RAID1 (ext4) , running Plasma DE from Zawertun's COPR.

Works for me: all using the Mate Desktop Environment.

sirius: desktop 16GB Intel i7-3770 CPU desktop @ 3.50GHz (SSD + 5 hard drives in RAID-6)
(from lscpu: max MHz 6300,   min MHz 1600,  BogoMIPS 7037)
real:11m1.373s  user:4m36.106s  sys:5m12.302s

mercury: laptop 32GB AMD Ryzen 7 5700U with Radeon 5500 Graphics (SSD only)
(from lscpu: max MHz 4370,   min MHz 1400,  BogoMIPS 3593)
rea1:15m31.423s  user:6m56.112s  sys:5m57.521s

`./runtests.sh` PASS with kernel-6.2.12-200.fc37.x86_64 build within a kvm/qemu VM (KDE spin, up to date with all testing repos of F37 enabled) on a AMD Ryzen 6000 mobile series host. No third party modules (tainted = 0). BZ* not tested.

I tested the VM some minutes with average activities, works fine so far. No errors/issues when using it.
Seems to work fine on bare-metal HP Z440, AMD RX570 with UEFI. No issues to report so far and kernel regression tests both PASS.
Works just fine.  Ryzen 3700x, Rog Strix B550-F, Nvidia from rpmfusion.  Regression and performance tests passed.

Works on Acer Aspire Intel® Core™ i7-3632QM CPU @ 2.20GHz Memory: 15.4 GiB of RAM.     
Graphics Processor: Mesa DRI Intel® HD Graphics 4000.     
wi-fi: Qualcomm Atheros AR9485 Wireless Network Adapter vendor: Lite-On driver: ath9k v: kernel.     

**Passed all kernel regression tests**
Passed regression tests, on KVM.
LGTM, Lenovo Yoga Slim 7 Pro 14ACH5, CPU AMD Ryzen 9 5900hx, GPU AMD Renoir, Wifi Mediatek mt7921e
Default and performance pass. HP Prodesk 400 G6 Mini, i5-10400T, CometLake-S GT2 [UHD 630].
Default & performance tests pass
Default & performance tests pass
Default & performance tests pass
Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver (530.41.03) from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg).

`./runtests.sh` PASS with kernel-6.2.12-300.fc38.x86_64 build within a kvm/qemu VM (KDE spin, up to date with all testing repos of F38 enabled) on a AMD Ryzen 6000 mobile series host. No third party modules (tainted = 0). BZ* not tested.

I tested the VM some minutes with average activities, works fine so far. No errors/issues when using it.

Seems to work fine on gnome-boxes without UEFI. No issues to report so far and default kernel regression test PASS.
Performance kernel regression test manually aborted after over one hour of runtime - will test it again later.
All tests passed on esxi 6.7

Regarding my #comment-2997648 :
Performance kernel regression test successfully completed after about 1h45m - no further issues noted.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-1859 kernel: Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-1859 kernel: Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition

long_desc.thetext:
Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition.

References:

https://lore.kernel.org/all/20230313090002.3308025-1-zyytlz.wz@163.com/

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2184593]
There was no shipped kernel version were seen affected with this problem. These files are not built in our source code.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2023-1859

Credit Information:

Zheng Wang(@xmzyshypnc), Zhuorao Yang(@A1ex), Yang Hu(@BlueSheep) and Zong Cao(@P1umer)

The newest patch will be applied to  6.3-rc7 soon:

https://lore.kernel.org/all/ZDM%2F4C0PlbbzV%2F0R@7e9e31583646/

bugs.title: kernel: Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: kernel: Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-1859 kernel: Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition

long_desc.thetext:
Use after free in xen_9pfs_front_remove due to race condition.

References:

https://lore.kernel.org/all/20230313090002.3308025-1-zyytlz.wz@163.com/

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2184593]
There was no shipped kernel version were seen affected with this problem. These files are not built in our source code.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2023-1859

Credit Information:

Zheng Wang(@xmzyshypnc), Zhuorao Yang(@A1ex), Yang Hu(@BlueSheep) and Zong Cao(@P1umer)

The newest patch will be applied to  6.3-rc7 soon:

https://lore.kernel.org/all/ZDM%2F4C0PlbbzV%2F0R@7e9e31583646/

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2184395

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2184395,2184593

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
*** Bug 2184371 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Credit Information:

Zheng Wang(@xmzyshypnc), Zhuorao Yang(@A1ex), Yang Hu(@BlueSheep) and Zong Cao(@P1umer)
